Key Match Events: Rashid Khan finished with 48 not out from 23 balls
Rashid Khan nearly won the game for Afghanistan with a mini-collapse against Adam Zampa
Adam Zampa took 2 wickets in four balls to ease the pressure on Australia
Glenn Maxwell scored 54 not out from 32 balls
Rashid Khan removed Marcus Stoinis, caught by Usman Ghani at backward point for 25 off 21
David Warner fell for 25 off 18 balls, trying to switch-hit Rashid Khan's off-cutter
Cameron Green was out slashing to Gulbadin Naib at slip for 3
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan won the toss and chose to bowl first
Aaron Finch and Tim David were ruled out due to hamstring injuries
Matthew Wade would skipper Australia in Finch's absence
Australia needed to restrict Afghanistan to 106 or below to get their net run rate above England's
If the result goes any other way, Australia are out of their home World Cup
Sri Lanka need to beat England tomorrow for Australia to have a chance of reaching the semi-finals
Post-Match Reflections: Rashid Khan's performance nearly won the game for Afghanistan
Australia's net run rate suffered due to the high-scoring match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rashid Khan's batting record at Adelaide Oval: 44 wickets from 29 T20s
Afghanistan needed 22 runs from the final over to win
